## Do high status scores correlate with high social resilience?

Regress overall Index scores against social resilience for all regions and years; then put fixed effect on region.

``` {r regress_lfs_coefficients}

### Set up basic data frame - make sure prs and res are 0-1; status
### range not important here since we'll take a ratio inside a loop.

res_soc <- read_csv(file.path(dir_calc, 'res_soc_only.csv')) %>%
  select(goal, region_id, year, res_soc = score) %>%
  group_by(region_id, year, res_soc) %>%
  summarize(goals = paste(goal, collapse = ', ')) %>% 
    ### this groups into FN and non-FN components
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(fn = str_detect(goals, 'AO')) %>%
  filter(!is.na(res_soc)) %>%
  select(-goals)

scores_rgn <- read_csv(file.path(dir_calc, 'scores_all.csv')) %>%
  filter(region_id != 0) %>%
  spread(dimension, score) %>%
  select(goal, region_id, year, status) %>%
  left_join(res_soc, by = c('region_id', 'year'))

goals <-  scores_rgn$goal %>% unique()
goals <- goals[nchar(goals) == 2 | goals == 'Index']
  ### drop subgoals

res_soc_df <- data.frame()

for(goalname in goals) { # goalname <- goals[3]
  
  fn_df <- scores_rgn %>%
    filter(goal == goalname) %>%
    filter(!is.na(status)) %>%
    filter(fn)
  
  fn_soc_lm <- lm(status ~ res_soc, data = fn_df) 
  
  fn_soc_lm_df <- fn_soc_lm %>%
    broom::tidy() %>%
    mutate(goal  = goalname,
           n_obs = nrow(fn_df),
           years = length(fn_df$year %>% unique()),
           r_sq  = fn_soc_lm %>% summary %>% .$adj.r.squared,
           fn = TRUE)

  nonfn_df <- scores_rgn %>%
    filter(goal == goalname) %>%
    filter(!is.na(status)) %>%
    filter(!fn)
  
  nonfn_soc_lm <- lm(status ~ res_soc, data = nonfn_df) 
  
  nonfn_soc_lm_df <- nonfn_soc_lm %>%
    broom::tidy() %>%
    mutate(goal  = goalname,
           n_obs = nrow(nonfn_df),
           years = length(nonfn_df$year %>% unique()),
           r_sq  = nonfn_soc_lm %>% summary %>% .$adj.r.squared,
           fn = FALSE)

  res_soc_df <- bind_rows(res_soc_df, fn_soc_lm_df, nonfn_soc_lm_df)

}

write_csv(res_soc_df, 'int/soc_res_vs_status.csv')

DT::datatable(res_soc_df)
```
